surfinpy.utils¶

surfinpy.utils.calculate_coverage(data)[source]¶
surfinpy.utils.calculate_gibbs(data)[source]¶

Calculate the gibbs free energy from thermochemcial data obtained from the NIST_JANAF database :param data: Full file downloaded from NIST_JANAF database :type data: array like

Returns:data – gibbs energy as a function of temperature
Return type:dictionary
surfinpy.utils.fit(thermochem, T)[source]¶

Fit a polynominal function to thermochemical data from NIST_JANAF :param thermochem: NIST_JANAF thermochemical table in numpy array format :type thermochem: array like :param T: full temperature range :type T: array like

Returns:shift – Entropy of adsorption species shifted to temeperature T
Return type:array like
surfinpy.utils.get_labels(ticks, data)[source]¶

Accesses and returns the labels that correspond to the phases displayed on the phase diagram :param ticks: Phases that are displayed :type ticks: list :param data: list of dictionaries :type data: list

Returns:labels
Return type:list strings
surfinpy.utils.get_lowest_surface(S, nsurfaces)[source]¶
surfinpy.utils.get_phase_data(S, nsurfaces)[source]¶

get_phase_data - Determines which surface composition is most stable :param S: :type S: 1D numpy array of surface energies :param nsurfaces: :type nsurfaces: int, Total number of surfaces

Returns:X
Return type:value
surfinpy.utils.read_nist(File)[source]¶

Read a downloaded NIST_JANAF thermochemcial table :param File: filename of table :type File: str

Returns:data – table as an array
Return type:array_like
surfinpy.utils.transform_numbers(Z, ticks)[source]¶

transform numbers - Takes the phase diagram array and converts the numbers to numbers scaled 0, 1, 2, etc in order to make plotting easier :param Z: :type Z: numpy array - surface stabilities :param ticks: :type ticks: list - unique phases appearing in above array

Returns:Z
Return type:numpy array - new array
